books.title: Short Plays
books.author: J. M. Synge
books.summary: A collection of three short plays by J. M. Synge.

books.title: Huntingtower
books.author: John Buchan
books.summary: A retired grocer seeking a change in his mundane life finds more than he bargained for when he’s asked to aid in the rescue of an imprisoned Russian princess.

books.title: Up from Slavery
books.author: Booker T. Washington
books.summary: The autobiography of Booker T. Washington, former slave and founder of the Tuskegee Institute.

books.title: Queen Victoria
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: A sardonic and generally unflattering biography of Victoria Alexandrina, Queen of England.

books.title: Peter and Wendy
books.author: J. M. Barrie
books.summary: A mischievous and cocky young boy, Peter Pan, takes Wendy and her brothers on adventures on a fantasy island consisting of mermaids, pirates, Native Americans, and fairies.

books.title: Mike
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A boy’s adventures in public school are filled with cricket, colorful characters, and a great deal of fun at the expense of authoritarian school masters.

books.title: The Cherry Orchard
books.author: Anton Chekhov
books.summary: A heavily indebted landowner and her family return to Russia in an attempt to save her estate from being auctioned off.

books.title: Wet Magic
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: A group of children visiting the seaside free a captive mermaid and visit her domain.

books.title: A Damsel in Distress
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A composer meets a young woman and tracks her down to a country manor, where a case of mistaken identity leads to comedy.

books.title: At the Mountains of Madness
books.author: H. P. Lovecraft
books.summary: An Antarctic expedition reveals the horrifying reality of ancient myths in the depths of the continent.

books.title: Twelve Years a Slave
books.author: Solomon Northup
books.summary: The account of a free black man kidnapped in 1841 and sold into slavery, from which it took twelve years to free himself.

books.title: The Big Four
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: A famous detective must use all his little grey cells to stop an immensely powerful and ruthless organization from taking over the world.

books.title: Scrambles Amongst the Alps in the Years 1860–69
books.author: Edward Whymper
books.summary: A classic in early mountaineering literature, describing the first ascent of the Matterhorn and other climbs in the Alps.

books.title: The Age of Reason
books.author: Thomas Paine
books.summary: Paine argues against the legitimacy of the Bible and institutional religion.

books.title: Verses on Various Occasions
books.author: John Henry Newman
books.summary: A collection of poems by John Henry Newman.

books.title: Crome Yellow
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.summary: A young writer travels to an English countryside manor to spend the summer alongside a cast of outlandish leisure class intellectuals.

books.title: Metropolis
books.author: Thea von Harbou
books.summary: In a futuristic dystopian city, the son of the city’s mastermind falls in love with a revolutionary activist.

books.title: The Confessions of Arsène Lupin
books.author: Maurice Leblanc
books.summary: The gentleman-thief relates stories of his outwitting the Parisian detectives.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: Letters Written During a Short Residence in Sweden, Norway, and Denmark
books.author: Mary Wollstonecraft
books.summary: Mary Wollstonecraft’s account of her travels through Scandinavia.
